posts_data.title: Album Premiere: Spill Gold performing Highway Hypnosis
posts_data.content: Please give the warmest of Roadburn welcomes to Spill Gold - a late addition to the line up, but no less essential because of it. Performing their album, Highway Hypnosis, in full, Spill Gold are here to bring a little bit of their dark electronics mixed with a pinch of Krautrock to Roadburners around the globe.

posts_data.title: Wolves In The Condo
posts_data.content:
In 2019 we hosted some of the most exciting underground black metal musicians the Netherlands has to offer when we commissioned the collaborative project Maalstroom - performed once, for one night only. One fragment of that performance, written by just two of the project’s many contributors has shapeshifted into something new, and distinctly different. If you come looking for black metal, you may leave disappointed, but if you’re in the market for something more technicolour then we may have just the thing for you. 

Like what you hear? The 7” of these tracks will be pressed on 200 hand-numbered copies released via Babylon Doom Cult. Go shopping!

posts_data.title: Lucile Lejoly - The World Is Lava
posts_data.content: Curious about our poster artist? Lucile Lejoly - a wonderful, creative artist from France - talks us through the processes she utilised when making the pieces that form our posters for this special edition of Roadburn Redux. Want more? Click here for more of Lucile’s evocative artwork.

posts_data.title: Scene Report: Death Metal
posts_data.content:
For Roadburn Redux we approached three of our favourite writers to see if they’d use their skills and insight to whip up something of a scene report on an area of their expertise, in a style that felt most natural to them.

Nobody else would approach an assignment like this with the enthusiasm and dedication of Vince Bellino. One of our favourite writers covering all things loud and heavy - most often for Decibel magazine - he leapt at the chance to dive into the world of death metal. He tackled the question of whether death metal belongs at a festival like Roadburn with some added insight from At The Gates’ Tomas Lindberg, and Full of Hell’s Dylan Walker, among others. If we hadn’t slapped a word count on this in the end, we may well have been presenting an entire book to you today, such is the depth of the genre (and Vince’s inquisitive mind!). For now, settle down for a look at this blood drenched genre.

posts_data.title: Acid Rooster
posts_data.content: We may only be near the beginning of the Roadburn day but we’re celebrating the news of a new Acid Rooster album being due to land this summer by premiering a brand new video from the band, right here, right now! Click here to follow all things Acid Rooster.
